result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather E. RUPP was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is to be determined and to be repaid at a rate to be determined by the agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is not to possess any credit cards.

No contact with Invincible Office Furniture.

Provide DNA sampe.

Undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent, including financial counseilng.
Maintain fulltime employment, work search or combination, but is prohibited from handling money or accounts payable, also to include volunteer work.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather E. RUPP

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 06-25-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $25,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with representatives from Invincible.  Bail furnished.
